Class BlackjackPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • BlackjackPlayer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BlackjackParticipantInterface

    public class BlackjackPlayer
extends java.lang.Object
    BlackjackPlayer is a child of the BlackjackPaticipant class. It defines actions specific to a blackjack player that the dealer does not perform.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface BlackjackParticipantInterface

        ACE_HI_VALUE, BLACKJACK_WINNER, FACE_CARD_VALUE

      • updateHand

        public void updateHand(java.util.ArrayList<BlackjackCard> newCards)
        updateHand() takes input newCards and adds the input newCards to the calling participant's hand. This is used for the initial deal to the players and the dealer so a blackjack is made.
        Specified by:
        updateHand in interface BlackjackParticipantInterface
        Parameters:
        newCards - the cards to be added to the hand

      • updateHand

        public void updateHand(BlackjackCard newCard)
        updateHand() takes input newCard and adds the input newCard to the calling participant's hand. This is used for hits so checkForWinner() and checkForBust() is also made
        Specified by:
        updateHand in interface BlackjackParticipantInterface
        Parameters:
        newCard - the cards to be added to the hand

      • showHand

        public java.lang.String showHand(int numberOfCardsToShow)
        showHand() returns a string representation of the participant's hand of an input number of cards to show. All cards are shown if input is 0 or input is greater than the length of 'hand'
        Specified by:
        showHand in interface BlackjackParticipantInterface
        Parameters:
        numberOfCardsToShow - the number of cards to show
        Returns:
        a String representation of the player hand
